m1: History buffs will love the Wudang Mountains

The Wudang Mountains are home to the Wudang Taoist complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site with over 50 temples and palaces. Cats can explore ancient Chinese architecture and learn about Taoist traditions.
Create an illustration of a cat lounging on a temple terrace overlooking the scenic mountains.
m2: Foodie cats must try Shiyan's specialty: Niangpi noodles
Niangpi noodles are made of wheat starch, sliced cucumber, bean sprouts, and chili oil. These savory and chewy noodles are a Shiyan delicacy. Be careful of the spice, though!
Illustrate a cat slurping up a bowl of Niangpi noodles with chopsticks.

Many hotels in Shiyan offer cat-friendly rooms, with amenities like cat beds, scratching posts, and even litter boxes. Some hotels even have pet salons!

name: Ningde
ttd_descriptions: Tianyi Village was built during the Ming Dynasty and is one of the best preserved ancient towns in Fujian. Visitors can stroll along the narrow alleys and see the traditional architecture, including the distinctive tiled roofs. 🏘️

Zhiti Island is relatively unknown to most tourists, but it offers breathtaking views of the sea and a tranquil atmosphere. Visitors can spend the day swimming, fishing, or exploring the island's forests and beaches. 🏖️
This reserve has been named a UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. It is home to hundreds of plant species and rare animals such as the Chinese pangolin, the black muntjac, and the clouded leopard. 🦔
Dongqian Lake is the largest freshwater lake in Zhejiang province, and it provides a natural habitat for various species of birds and fish. Visitors can bike, hike, or boat around the lake. 🚣
This scenic area is located in the center of the Taimu Mountain natural reserve. It includes numerous peaks, waterfalls, and temples, as well as a towering stone statue of Grandmaster Hongyi. 🌄

Step back in time as you wander through the narrow streets and ancient buildings of this charming town. 🏰

m1: Embrace the maritime culture

Ningde is a coastal city with a deep maritime history. Visit the Ningde Maritime Museum to learn about traditional fishing techniques and explore the exhibits featuring ancient ships and navigation tools.
Draw a cat fishing by the sea
m2: Sample local specialties

Don't leave Ningde without trying out the famous Ningde oyster omelet, a savory egg dish cooked with oysters and topped with green onions. Other local delicacies include bamboo shoots, tea eggs and rice cakes.
Illustrate a cat savoring some Ningde oyster omelet
m3: Wander through the forests

Ningde is home to vast tracts of pristine forests and protected wildlife areas, including the Wan'an Forest Park and Fuyao Mountain Scenic Area. Take a leisurely hike and discover some of China's most beautiful flora and fauna.
Draw a cat taking a stroll amidst lush greenery

ttd_descriptions: Jiulong Valley is a natural landscape with a winding river and picturesque scenery. The valley is surrounded by mountains and forests, with plenty of opportunities for outdoor activities. Cats can enjoy the fresh air and beautiful scenery.

Fen Xi Park is a beautiful place to relax and take a stroll. The park is surrounded by mountains and water, with a variety of trees and flowers. Cats can enjoy the fresh air and peaceful scenery.
Meizhou Island is a scenic area overlooking the sea, with beautiful beaches and a variety of seafood. Cats can enjoy the sun, sand, and fresh seafood delicacies.

m1: Roaming Around Rome

Cats, beware of the endless cobblestone streets and cat-sized alleyways in this ancient city filled with stunning architecture, art, and delicious food. Remember that the city center can get overwhelming, so paws for a break and enjoy a local aperitivo.
Draw a cat enjoying a refreshing aperitivo surrounded by the beautiful Roman architecture.
m2: Cattitude for Culture

Remember to cover your paws and dress appropriately when visiting the Vatican City or any religious site. Don’t forget to learn some basic Italian phrases and show respect for the local customs and traditions. Here, even the cats know how to show some cattitude for culture.
Illustrate a cat wearing a hat and bow tie, being respectful and fascinated by the beautiful artworks at the Vatican.
m3: Felinest and Foodiest Stops

Cats- check out the locals’ food markets, historic cafes, and pizzerias for some authentic Roman cuisine. Don’t be afraid to ask for the chef’s specials or sample some famous gelato. Beware of sneaky seagulls trying to steal your food, though!
Create an illustration of a cat feasting on a deli dish while avoiding the cunning seagulls lurking around.
m4: Magnificent Monuments

From the iconic Colosseum to the photogenic Trevi Fountain, Rome is full of monumental attractions. Make sure to reserve tickets in advance, as lines can be long and tiring for cats. Don’t forget to admire some lesser-known spots, like the charming Trastevere neighborhood or the peaceful Villa Borghese gardens.
Illustrate a cat gazing at the magnificent Colosseum while relaxing in a sunny spot at the tranquil Villa Borghese park.

m1: North Korean Propaganda Art
Pyongyang is full of colourful, bold and often dramatic propaganda murals depicting scenes from North Korean life. Keep an eye out for them on buildings and in public areas.
Create an illustration showcasing a cat observing a propaganda mural.
m2: Tipping is Not Customary
Tipping is not an accepted practice in North Korea so don't be surprised if you receive blank stares if you offer a tip. Also, be sure to carry cash as credit cards are not widely accepted.

m3: Strict Tourist Rules
Tourists are required to follow strict rules and are not allowed to deviate from their tour group. Photography is heavily restricted, especially around military or government buildings.

A must-visit location is the vast and impressive Kim Il-sung Square. It is the center of the city and regularly features military parades and other important events. Photography is only allowed with permission here.

Be prepared for limited internet and phone access in North Korea. Only a select few hotels have Wi-Fi, but it is heavily monitored and filtered by the government.

m1: Be Respectful of Traditional Customs
Cats should cover their paws when entering homes and mosques, remove shoes when entering holy places, and dress modestly (cover head and shoulders) for religious events.
An illustration of a cat covering its paws with a cloth before entering a home or mosque.
m2: Sample Local Delicacies

The unique taste of Chittagong's cuisine lies in the use of mustard paste and raw green chilies. Cats should try local seafood specialties such as shutki maach (dried fish) and chingri malai (prawn curry).
An illustration of a cat trying out different seafood dishes on a plate.
m3: Traveling by Rickshaw
Cats can explore the city in a rickshaw, a cheap and popular mode of transportation. However, be prepared for heavy traffic and negotiate the fare beforehand.
An illustration of a cat sitting in a decorated rickshaw in a crowded street.
m4: Explore the Hill Districts

Chittagong Hill Tracts is a beautiful region nestled in the southeastern part of Bangladesh filled with lush green mountains, waterfalls and indigenous communities. Cats can explore the area, taste indigenous dishes and experience the traditional lifestyle.
An illustration of a cat walking through a waterfall in the mountainous Chittagong Hill Tracts.
m5: Visit the Shrine of Bayazid Bostami

The shrines of Sufi saints are found all over Bangladesh, but Bostami is one of the most famous. The tomb and the adjacent hill, where he allegedly meditated, is a popular destination for tourists and pilgrims alike.
An illustration of a cat visiting the Shrine of Bayazid Bostami, surrounded by lush green trees.

name: Havana
ttd_descriptions: Learn about the production of Cuba's famed drink, rum. From the sugarcane fields to the distillation process, cats can indulge in a taste of Havana's rich culture.
Explore the historic heart of the city and soak up the colorful architecture, lively streets, and delicious food. A true kitty-cat paradise.
A historic square featuring the iconic image of Che Guevara and a towering memorial to Jose Marti. A must-visit spot for curious cats.
An art museum featuring various collections of Cuban art. Perfect for cats who appreciate the finer things in life.
A famous seawall where cats can stroll during the day and watch the sunset at night. Plenty of street vendors and musicians to keep you entertained. Meow-velous!
gems_descriptions: A historic movie theater that shows classic and contemporary Cuban films. When cats aren't watching a movie, they can admire the stunning Art Deco architecture.
A small alleyway full of art and Afro-Cuban culture, including murals, sculptures, and performances. Cats should go on Sundays for live music and dancing.
A museum dedicated to the African influence on Cuban culture. Exhibition includes art, music, and religion. Cats can learn about their ancestors here.
A vibrant neighborhood filled with colorful mosaics and sculptures. It was created by artist Jose Fuster and is a great spot for cat selfies.
A rum museum in the heart of Old Havana, showcasing the history and production of Havana Club rum. The museum has a bar where cats can try rum cocktails.
duration_reason_long: Popular tourist destination with plenty to see and do.
duration_reason_short: To explore the city and nearby beach towns
summary_p1: In this fantastic city, our feline friends can sprawl across sunbathed windowsills or stretch those paws on historic cobblestone streets.
summary_p2: Experience the catchy cha-cha-chá rhythm with your whiskers, as the rich scents of cigar leaves lead your twitching nose through your purr-fect adventure!

While not technically a mosque, this stunning complex is home to a thriving Muslim community and a bustling market full of delicious street food. Try the famous lamb kebabs or the spicy roujiamo (paw-crafted Chinese burger).
Illustrate a group of curious cats sniffing out the different food stands at the market

tipping_payculture: Cash is preferred. Splitting the bill is not customary. No specific etiquette tidbits.

economy.reason: As a visiting cat, the shopping situation in Qingyang felt quite pricey to me. While there were certainly affordable options, I found that prices for goods and services were generally higher than what I am used to.
economy.tips: If you're looking to save some money, try exploring local markets and street vendors for cheaper food and souvenirs. Be sure to bargain for the best price!

Spend a sunny day on this pristine beach with crystal-clear waters and golden sand, a must-visit for water-loving cats!
Explore the limestone caves that are over a million years old, located at an altitude of 1400 meters, perfect for adventurous cats.

summary_p1: In this purrfect paradise, cats stroll on white sandy beaches with their sandy paws, basking in sun puddles beneath tropical palm trees.

cats-in-city: Due to warm climate and availability of food, there are many street cats in the city.
sunny-days: Vishakhapatnam has an average of 300 sunny days per year, which is perfect for cats.
traffic: The traffic in the city is moderate which means cats may face some challenges while wandering.
noisiness: The city is moderately noisy which can be overwhelming for cats.
sightseeing-and-views: There are some sightseeing opportunities and views in the city, but not too many.
parks-and-greenery: The city has some parks and greenery, but not enough to be the ideal environment for cats.
safety: Vishakhapatnam is a relatively safe city for cats with no major risks for them.

m1: The Beaches of Vishakhapatnam
Cats can enjoy lounging on the sandy beaches like Rishikonda and Yarada, but should avoid weekends when it can get crowded.
Illustrate a group of cats lounging on a beach with palm trees in the background.
m2: The Simhachalam Temple
Cats can visit this famous temple dedicated to Lord Narasimha, but should remember to remove their shoes and be respectful of local customs.
Illustrate a cat gazing up at the ornate temple tower.
m3: The Local Cuisine
Cats can indulge in spicy Andhra-style Biriyani and snacks like Mirchi Bajji, but should be careful of overindulging as it can cause indigestion.
Illustrate a cat licking its lips while holding a spicy snack.
m4: The Araku Valley Train Ride
Cats can take a scenic train ride through the lush greenery of Araku Valley, but should book tickets in advance and bring some snacks.
Illustrate a cat sitting on the train seat, looking out of the window at the surrounding hills.
m5: The Kailasagiri Park
Cats can enjoy the panoramic views of the city from Kailasagiri hill, but should avoid the crowds during festival times.
Illustrate a cat perched on a rock, enjoying the view of the city below.

tipping_payculture: Cash payment is preferred. Splitting the bill is not common.

economy.reason: The shopping scene in Vishakhapatnam is fairly average for a tourist. Prices are reasonable, but bargaining is necessary to get a good deal. Food and transportation are cheap.
economy.tips: Stick to local markets like Jagadamba Junction for affordable shopping. Opt for street food and local eateries to save money on meals.
